cscie97.asn1.knowledge.engine

Class KnowledgeGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn1.knowledge.engine.KnowledgeGraph

  • public class KnowledgeGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a database of Triples stored in memory. It also for the user to import new Triples too. The specs request that the KnowledgeGraph be implemented as a Singleton which emphasizes using only one instance. The Flyweight pattern is also specified such that there is only one instance of the Node, the Predicate, or Triple. Gotta save memory when multithreading!
    See Also:
    Triple, Importer, QueryEngine

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KnowledgeGraph getInstance()
        This is a specific format for impementing the Singleton instance that was specifically written in the most multithread friendly form http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singleton_pattern
        Returns:
        singleton instance of KnowledgeGraph

      • importTriples

        public void importTriples(java.util.List<Triple> tripleList)
        A method for adding a list of Triples to a KnowledgeGraph. This uses the Flyweight pattern for eliminating duplication such that there are three unique instances of a Subject, Predicate and Object.
        Parameters:
        tripleList - This is the list of Triples being added to the KnowledgeGraph

      • scrubTripleIdentifier

        public java.lang.String scrubTripleIdentifier(java.lang.String stringToParse)
        Take a given triple identifier or query and either convert strings to lower case, get rid of trailing periods, and/or replace occurences of more than two white spaces
        Parameters:
        stringToParse -
        Returns:
        string that has to correct formatting.

      • executeQuery

        public java.util.Set<Triple> executeQuery(Triple query)
        takes a queryMapSet and figures out the Triple that matches a given query. It modifies any trailing periods and occurrences of white space. Returns empty set if all Triple criteria are met. Question marks are used as wild cards.
        Parameters:
        query - the query string to search for matching Triples.
        Returns:
        the Set of all Triples that match the input

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(java.lang.String identifier)
        Return a Node instance for a given identifier. If the node doesn't exist create it and add it to the nodeMap. Nodes can be the subject or the object
        Parameters:
        identifier - the string identifier of the Node
        Returns:
        the newly created Node object depending on the identifier

      • getPredicate

        public Predicate getPredicate(java.lang.String identifier)
        Return a Predicate instance for a given identifier. If the predicate doesn't exist, create it and add it to the predicateMap.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the string identifier of the Predicate
        Returns:
        the newly created Predicate object depending on the identifier

      • getTriple

        public Triple getTriple(Node subject,
               Predicate predicate,
               Node object)
        Return a Triple instance for a given subject, predicate, AND object. If the triple doesnt exist, create it and add it to the tripleMap. The queryMapSet needs to be updated too!
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject Node for the Triple
        predicate - the predicate for the Triple
        object - the object for the Triple
        Returns:
        either newly created or already existed

      • getQueryTripleFromStringIdentifier

        public Triple getQueryTripleFromStringIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
                                          throws cscie97.asn1.knowledge.engine.exception.ParseException
        This constructs a Triple object that can be used as the input parameter itself to the method executeQuery() which comes into play when handling the wild card character
        Parameters:
        identifier - string used to consrut a new Triple
        Returns:
        a new triple object based on the String
        Throws:
        cscie97.asn1.knowledge.engine.exception.ParseException - thrown if there aren't the required three parts
